Skip Links

  • Provide ways for users to skip to important sections of your website. This will help users using screenreaders navigate your site easier and more efficiently.
  • There is no real theming rule when it comes to styling your skip links, as such a lot of websites tend to hide them with class="visuallyhidden". For skip links, it is more important to include the markup in the first place.
  • Examples of the different types of "skip" links include: 
    Skip to content
    Skip to search
    Skip to bottom nav
    Skip to top navbar
    Skip to main menu
    Skip to anything, really

WCAG 2.0 Guidelines

1.1.1 Non-text Content: All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose (some exceptions). (Level A)

Note: If non-text content is pure decoration, is used only for visual formatting, or is not presented to users, then it does not need text alternatives.

Heading

This is the first real paragraph. All that other stuff was just plain hodor.
